characters: TOPOGRAPHICAL MAP OF LOS ANGELES AREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the day.     An armored truck moves through the ci Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armored truck pulls up. An ARMORED TRUCK GUARD emerge from the back with a satchel and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large foyer. Security station and elevators. PARTY SOUN can be heard from a second floor balcony. DOUGLAS is the security guard manning the station. Seeing the Armored car Guard entering, he picks up the phone and dials. Beat. Into phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last delivery's finally here. The Armored Truck Guard approaches the security station. he and Douglas exchange paperwork, the Armored Truck Guar references the sounds from upstairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Introducing a new line of jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife wants me to buy her a ruby ring. Told her to spend a little time with the family jewels first. PING. An ELEVATOR opens. A second security guard's inside Handing over the satchel and heading out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the security guard with the satchel use a key-card gain elevator access to the lower floors. As the elevator doors slide closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exclusive showroom. Display tables empty. At one end o the room, the elevator. At the other end, the open door t a walk-in vault. The ELEVATOR PINGS, and the doors open. The guard emerges with the cart. Pushes it across the room to the outside o the vault. A man in a suit emerges from the vault and starts unloadi the cart into the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train arrives.   People jostle on and off. One man remains on the platform. MILES. Crisp dresser. Carrying a large leather bag. A cylinder hanging by a str over his shoulder. The train doors begin to close.   When... A fist inserts itself between the doors. They re-open, an a man steps onto the platform. TONY FAIT. Well-dressed. Intense. Fait joins Miles. They watch the train pull out. They check to make sure the station's empty. Then jump off the platform into the tunnel and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the suit has finished unloading the cart. He closes the heavy vault door and spins a large wheel on th door, securing the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Miles run down the dark tunnel, staying close to the wall. Miles stumbles. Falls toward the deadly, high- voltage third rail. Out of nowhere, Fait's hand grabs Miles' jacket. Stops hi Just before he hits. Inches from the rail. Fait pulls him back up and away from the danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself. Miles nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it tight. Miles nods again, and they set off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of the PARTY continue from upstairs. At the securi station, the guard, Douglas, looks up from a magazine and scans the security monitors.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY MONITORS
dialogues.text: depicting the empty vault, empty vault anteroom, various empty store areas and the elevator, in which we see the m in the suit riding up.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Douglas settles back in with his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Miles reach an access door tagged with paint. starts to open it. Suddenly, the tunnel is filled with the ROAR of an APPROACHING TRAIN. Fait and Miles leap to the wall.   Pre their backs against it as tightly as they can. The TRAIN whooms past, inches from their faces. When it's gone, Miles sighs with relief. Fait cracks the access doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait moves quickly, Miles following. Fait makes fast left and rights, following more spray paint. They branch off into a small dirt-floored space, deep in sub-foundation of a building. Fait stops. Overhead is a flat ceiling. On the ceiling, his flashlight finds a spra painted circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull's-eye. Without a word, Miles begins assembling equipment.    Fai pulls out a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man, DUNCAN SU, sits in a rental 2002 Thunderbird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su's focused, intense, listening to a fancy WALKMAN throu HEADPHONES. We hear what he hears. Only there's no music, just STATIC. Suddenly, on Su's headphones, a PHONE RINGS. Su grows eve more alert. We hear a man with a French accent answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery confirmed. The stones are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. CLICK.   HISS. Su didn't like what he just heard.       Curses in Chines takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perched on the side of a cliff above the Pacific, next to the park. The top floor is at street level. Su easily gains access to the roof of the building. He moves to an exact position just at the ocean-side edge. I an eight-story drop. Su faces in.      And then... Hops backward off the roof. Falling feet-first through the air, Su momentarily grabs onto an eight-floor balcony rail, slowing his descent, th lets go. Momentarily grabs a seventh-floor rail and lets go. Grabs sixth-floor rail. Hangs on this time. Vaults lightly onto the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, free-standing FISH TANK BUBBLES away. Nearby, CHRISTOPHE is packing to leave town. When...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the stones? Christophe turns.       Sees Su standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? Wham.   The Chinese boxing version of a bitch-slap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's getting them for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Wham!   Wham!   Wham!     Wham!   Much more violent than slap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plasma torch burns through the metal-reinforced slab overhead. Fait taps Miles, who turns off the torch. Fait hammers at the last layer. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole appears under the private display table, where it can't be seen by the room's security camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait communicates via a high-tech, transmitting/receiving earwig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas looks up from his magazine and checks the securit monitors again. Everything a-okay.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: A limo pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A uniformed chauffeur gets out of the limo, moves to the back and opens the door. A very attractive woman in a short, tight dress emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escorted by the chauffeur, the woman, DARIA, enters. She approaches the security station. Up close, in the light, Daria's even more alluring. And knows how to wield it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here for the reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie Rawlins. Douglas scans a list of names.      Checks off hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You can go on up.       Front elevator, to the mezzanine. Daria turns toward the elevator. Then doesn't go. Just glances up toward the party, suddenly unenthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I hate these things.      Don't you hate these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just here to do my job. Daria looks back at Douglas.      Studies him a moment. what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again, you never know who you're going to meet... She shifts her wrap, baring cleavage.      Then leans ove desk. Giving Douglas an eyeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you're a lot more fun than any of those boring people upstairs. Douglas is unaffected.   Just looks at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, ma'am.   I have a job to do. Daria doesn't understand why he's not interested in her. Then she glimpses Douglas's magazine lying on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magazine is Genre.   Males for males.   Buff boys. pecs, big penises.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Daria steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose I should go up and see what they're selling. Daria turns back and calls to her chauffeur, TOMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy... What happens next happens very quickly and sotto voce, as Daria walks toward Tommy: She whispers into a hidden mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plans. He's gay. Tommy hears it over his earwig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Miles have heard it, too.   Into his mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.    Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of alarm on Tommy's face.    Into his mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a conversation.    Do it. It's an order.    Tommy knows he has to.   Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key-card. Then, still to Tommy, her voice again at normal volume --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you keep my purse?     I shouldn't be too long. Daria hands Tommy her purse. Palms the key-card from him. Then heads toward the elevator, as... Tommy replaces the sick look on his face. Does his best t look flirty as he walks over to the security station. Lea over the desk with a yummy-smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Aloha. (NOTE: The following scene is INTERCUT with Scenes 20 thru 28.) Douglas looks up from his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't take offense at this... but I just have such a weakness for a man in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's your thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uniform's definitely my thing. I mean, I see a sailor, I'm thinking, mmm, seafood. Y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not actually supposed to be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: talking on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's talking? Honey, this is a flirting... But you're probably just another good-looking man wasting it all on women. World's full of fools. Beat.   Douglas lets him see the Genre magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahtzee!... Okay, Mr. I-Always-Have- A-Hard-Nightstick. Put away the pictures of those underfed, white males and let's broaden your horizons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like sunsets and puppy dogs, and I'm big in the pants. Just hope I'm not too cute for you. And don't tell me it's a color thing, hon, or I'll come over there and slap a little discrimination right upside your yummy little cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hooked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another big, hot, cuddly, black love- Jesus got there first. That bitch. Taking you. From me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... This day and age, sweetie, I can appreciate the monogamy. Saving it for your number one is keeping the world safe, and it's okay by me. Even if you are just breaking my heart... Guess I'll just have to come in here someday, let you catch me shoplifting and resist arrest -- just to have you wrestle me down and cuff me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be pretty rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get me all excited now.   I was just learning to accept my disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy sticks out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.     But you can call me Rachel. Shaking hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas. And, man, I really gotta get back to what I'm supposed to be doing, okay? He looks away.     Scans the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: MONITORS
dialogues.text: Everything looks normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Douglas is unaware of what's happening in the vaul Tommy relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you alone. But is it okay if I just stand here and stare at the muscles I'll be missing for the rest of my life? OFF which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria gets in. Looks back to make sure Tommy has Douglas' attention. He does. Instead of going up, Daria uses the key-card to access th controls to go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the doors close, Daria shoots a wink back at...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: who furtively flips her the bird.        Never missing a Douglas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait emerges from the hole beneath the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitors, we see Fait in the vault anteroom and Da descending in the elevator as Tommy keeps Douglas's attention diverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait holds a small digital camera next to the room's security camera. Mimicking the security camera's slow pan Fait films the room. When he's done....

dialogues.speaker: FAIT'S DIGITAL CAMERA
dialogues.text: We see the panning shot of the room on the monitor. Fait pulls up an on-screen menu, clicks on "Repeat." Whereupon the mini-movie begins playing in a continuous loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fait mounts his camera in front of the security camera Daria steps off the elevator, putting her hair up, ready work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the anteroom monitor, we see the monitor on Fait's cam slide into position, making the room look empty, as Tommy continues diverting Douglas's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Daria push the display table aside as Miles shov equipment bags through the hole in the floor. Fait opens the leather bag, revealing tools, a tripod, th steel cables and a long, rectangular box. Miles grabs a high-tech DRILL. Begins BORING a hole high up on the vaul door. Fait hands Daria the tripod to set up, while he uncoils t steel cables, attaches them to the wheel on the vault doo Then opens the rectangular box and lifts out what's insid A surface-to-air missile. Fait sets it on the tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, the hole drilled, picks up the cylinder he'd had slung over his shoulder. Pulls out a pressurized metal canister of liquid nitrogen. Miles injects the nitrogen into the hole. A CRACKLING sou as the super-low-temp LIQUID spreads out inside the vault door. The outside frosts over. Fait finishes attaching the free ends of the cables to cl on the SAM. Final checks of the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding through L.A.   Calling 911 on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want to report a crime in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait is the last one down through the hole.   Beat.    He at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith. Fait pulls out a remote control firing device.   He pushe the button. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAM IGNITES with a blinding flash and streaks across room. The steel cables instantly snap taut and... RIP the vault's wheel and frozen locking mechanism right the fuck out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They felt a rumble.   Tommy covers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas checks the monitors.      Everything looks okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you know how to hit a ten on the Richter scale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew re-emerges through the floor to find the vault d in pieces and a hole the size of a Sub Zero where the SAM augured into the opposite wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Fait's already swinging open the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will trigger the silent alarm. Let's go. We got eleven minutes. Miles moves down the rows of   drawers, using a tool to p all the locks. Fait and Daria   follow behind, quickly pu out the drawers and emptying   jewels into nylon bags. Fa empties drawer after drawer.    All white diamonds. When. He opens a drawer containing various colored diamonds. stops, admiring them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I love colored stones... Look at this... He holds up a small, faceted blue diamond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-point-seven million. Into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose shit we stealing, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug dealers and money launderers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works for me. Then something else catches his eye. He holds up a small, pink diamond on a chain. Admires it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I can use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: T.
dialogues.text: Fait moves to her. Daria's fishing into a nylon bag she found in a drawer. Pulls out a handful of... Large black diamonds. Many more in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pow. He takes the bag. Stows it in his jacket. When... Suddenly, Fait's CELL PHONE RINGS. Surprising them.   Bea Fait answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su's speeding through Los Angeles streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your employer betrayed you. The police are on the way. Leave the black stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the ones I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think I'll do that. Fait just hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Douglas hear APPROACHING SIRENS. The SIRENS STO outside. SWAT, cops, the works. All heading for the front door. Tommy whispers urgently into his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Five-0 at the do'. (then, aloud to Douglas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better move my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait grabs a bag of jewels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go time.     Leave the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT swarms in. Tommy exits behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets in.    A SWAT COP signals him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait, Miles, and Daria run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam! Fait, Miles, and Daria blast out the access door. Fait kneels, feels the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopped the trains. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the rabbit hole, they're sending down the snakes. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria comes with me. (to Miles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no idea where you should go, but you know where to end up. Miles nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su studies a computer map of downtown as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running like hell. Rounds a curve.      Ahead are the rea lights of a stopped train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the front of another train, stopped at a station. Fait signals Daria to stay put. Then pokes his head around the corner of the train.

dialogues.speaker: STATION PLATFORM
dialogues.text: SWAT cops hustle passengers off the train. One SWAT GUY helps another up to check the top of the train. The SECON COP jumps back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait turns back to Daria. Signals her to climb up onto th top of the train. Then begins climbing after her. As Fait reaches the driver's window, he sees ANOTHER SWAT COP approaching the train's DRIVER, checking under seats, etc. Fait has to climb fast. The SWAT Guy and the Driver getti closer. Looking up. Just as...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS ACTION
dialogues.text: Fait's leg just clears the window.      They don't see it But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fait rolls onto the top of the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOISE causes the SWAT Cop to react.      To the Drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment, as they stop and the Cop looks around.    The C checks the Driver's compartment. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radios)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train's clear. The Cop exits.    The Driver enters his compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SWAT COP stands outside the Driver's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang tight. During which, just above them... Fait and Daria lie very still. Daria's tense. Fait winks her, trying to relax her. Daria's still tense. He raises eyebrows slightly. Shifts his gaze down. She doesn't get it. Finally follows his gaze. Sees her position is giving him a full view of her cleavage. She looks back at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. That does it. She relaxes and smiles back. Under which a voice crackles over the SWAT Cop's radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Get this train outta here. Whereupon the train jerks to a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running toward the rear of the stopped train.   Leaping o the rear steps. When... Out of nowhere, a foot catches him in the head, sending h flying back down onto the rails. And... There is Su in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to come and get 'em. Su moves on Miles. Miles throws a solid punch at him. Su and Miles fight on the track behind the stopped train. Th deadly third rail making the fight even more dangerous. Miles is a street boxer. He's good. He's ferocious. But he's no match for Su. When Miles is subdued, Su grabs the bag of jewels, makes sure Miles doesn't have any more, th goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocketing underground. The tunnel ceiling whizzes by abov Fait and Daria. Intermittent tunnel fixtures just inches from their heads. Every time the train takes a curve, they both slide towar the edge. Fait places a calming hand on top of Daria's. T car takes a wide curve. Daria's body flips to the side. She loses her grip. Screams as she starts to fall off the train. Fait reaches for Daria, losing his grip on his bag, which plummets off the train. Fait can't grab her. The train jerks again. He starts sliding away from her, off the opposite side. Fait thrust out both hands as far as he can. And... Just snags her at the last second. Grips Daria's wrists with all he's got. They're now draped across the curved r of the train. Hands in the middle. If Daria slips, or Fai lets her go, they both die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su gets in. Empties Miles' nylon bag into his lap. A fortune in gems and jewelry pours out. Su sifts through i increasingly agitated. What he wants isn't there. He thro the bag down, cursing in Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait is at his limit. His grip starts to loosen. When the train begins to slow. They pull into a station and stop. Fait releases Daria, and she drops to the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait jumps down on the other side. He's lost the bag of jewels. Knows they're gone for good. He feels for the bag of black diamonds. Still has them. Unseen, Fait joins Daria on the platform, and, hand in ha they melt into the crowd of commuters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stretch limo and a Cadillac Escalade wait on the tarmac next to a Gulfstream, which has just arrived. The jet door opens, and a man emerges with a bodyguard. T man, LING, is Asian, about forty. Emanates grace and powe As Ling descends the steps, and two thugs from the SUV go retrieve baggage... A woman steps out of the waiting limo to greet Ling.   Sh also Asian. Dressed in American casual. Beautiful.     SO She's not smiling. As Ling approaches her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoying California? CHARLES, the bodyguard, answers for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope we're not here long.    I hate sunshine. Ling kisses Sona on the lips.    Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may have a problem. Ling's mood quickly darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exchange was just robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Let's hope that was part of the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swarming with police. When... Su steps off the elevator. He's carrying the bag of jewels he took from Miles. To a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know? Su flashes I.D. We don't see it.   The Cop scopes it a moment. He's clearly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me. As he leads Su toward his superiors in the vault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANESSA, eight, is in her pajamas, playing SIM Coaster on her computer. The door opens. Fait enters. His daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's past your bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Just a little longer'... School tomorrow, baby. Let's go. Vanessa sighs. Fait stands over her as she shuts down the computer, talking her through the commands, making sure s doesn't dawdle. FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Exit.' 'Quit.' 'Do not save.' 'Special.' 'Shut down.' Sleepy- time. Whereupon he whisks her out of her chair, flies her once around the room and tucks her into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bag some Z's now, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's something behind your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, that is so lame.     It's in your hand. She takes his right hand, opens it and turns it over. Nothing. Takes his left hand, opens it and turns it over. More nothing. She's stumped. Fait smiles. Puts his hands together. When he opens them, there is the pink diamond pendant on the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that? Fait slips the chain over her head and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Then Fait looks up.     Addresses the air above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels east, angels west, north and south, do your best. Guard her, watch her, while she rests. A bedtime ritual. Fait goes. When she's alone, Vanessa holds up the diamond, which catches every bit of availabl light and shines in the dark. Then she rolls over and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait enters.     Vanessa's nanny, TONITA, is there.    To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll stay down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't listen to me lately.     Only you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a talk with her about it tomorrow. Still to the nanny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some work to do in the office. You can go on to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching TV, if you need me. Fait exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait enters.    Tommy and Daria are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened? Fait puts a finger to his lips.    Leads them across the to another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.    Fait shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we be considering a long vacation in a warm, foreign climate where there's no extradition? Fait's thinking it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who called was only interested in the black stones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christophe sold us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something. Just then, Miles enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the skin of my ass. Some Chinese dude kicked me around the motherfuckin' block. Busted my ear piece. He takes the broken communication device out of his ear a tosses it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snagged my loot, too... Maybe time to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rethink the no-gun policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little ass-whuppin's nothing. 'Least you didn't have to play all foxy with the rent-a-cop. Fait pulls out the bag of black diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means this is all we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all wait to hear from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get some answers. Miles moves to go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I got us into this.     I'll call you if I need you. Daria moves to him.   Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Fait gives her a kiss.   Then goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christophe's arms are   wrapped around the large fish tan one arm over the top,   the other through the legs of the stand. His hands are    bound. He can't move. His beaten face is pressed to the   glass. Large, weird fish swim pa in front of him. The weird fish scatter as a face appears on the other sid of the tank. Ling. Looking through at Christophe. Ling straightens and walks around the tank. Sona is with him. So is Charles, the bodyguard. In b.g., the two thugs stand sentry near the front door. Christophe's eyes follo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is Mr. Christophe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Only the handcuffs and fish tank are a new look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently we're not his first visitors today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Monsieur Ling -- Ling interrupts him with a hand on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you're going to say... Make it the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the middle of the large lot, which is full of goods and military surplus equipment. The tank's turret i spinning around. The cannon elevating and depressing seemingly at random. When... The cannon stops. Having locked on...Fait, standing in front of the tank. From inside the tank, a muffled voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang. A hatch opens. ARCHIE, a fairly straight-ahead-looking ma pops his head up out of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. As Archie climbs out of the tank and joins Fait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want it? Give you a good deal. Ammo included... Reactive armor, twin M240 machine guns, 120mm smoothbore cannon. Guaranteed to get you through the rougher areas of the city and keep the neighbors in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a Marine Corps assault hovercraft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got other business. Fait and Archie walk to a work table. Nearby, two MEN UNLOAD HOT TVS from a truck. One Man calls to Archie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outta room over here, Arch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stack 'em in the office, if you have to. Then Archie turns his attention back to Fait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You weren't downtown tonight by any chance, were you, Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see black diamonds before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White, blue, yellow, pink. Neil Diamond. Lou Diamond Phillips. Black diamonds? Solid rocks? No. Whereupon Fait opens the nylon bag and pours the black diamonds out onto the table. Archie pulls out a loup. Studies them a moment. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out how much they're worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There a timetable on this, or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait's heading out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back. I gotta go fuck over a guy who fucked me over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait opens a door with an electronic lock pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait enters. Stops a moment, his back against the closed door, while his eyes adjust to the dark. Then moves quiet out into the room. Looking for Christophe. Fait continues moving around through the room. When he steps in something wet. He bends down and checks it out. Water. The carpet's soaked. His eyes go to something. Fait finds a cord and turns on switch. The light in the fish tank snaps on. REVEAL Christophe.     Stuffed inside the tank.     Sleep the fishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks dead to me. Behind him.   Fait turns around.      Sees Su.   Sitting sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you got to him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.     Someone else. Fait does the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're the one who called me. The one who took on my guy... Who the fuck are you, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Su.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.     I'm Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the black stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   Make me an offer. Su stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No deal. Fait launches   himself at Su. Gonna fight     his way door. A much    better fighter than Miles.     And... by the bell:    the PHONE RINGS. The fight     stops. phone's near   Fait. Beat. The answering      machine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christophe here. Leave a message. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're there, Mr. Fait. Beat.   Fait pushes the button for the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlooking L.A. Ling and Sona. Enjoying hotel room service. Ling's on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man for   whom Mr. Christophe arranged to   have the black stones brought into   the country and deposited at   the jewelry exchange. The man who   wants them back. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you didn't understand me.    The stones are already mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got 'em, I'm selling 'em. So get your bid in or go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your final offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be a very dangerous man, Mr. Fait. Fait just hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody think I'm the fucking Goodwill or something...? Look, I've had a shitty night, and so far, I got zip for all my troubles. So I don't know who the fuck you are, and I don't care. But hear this: you can beat my ass around the block all night -- Brother, it ain't gonna get you those stones. A long beat. The two men facing off. Then... As Su stands aside, giving Fait a clear path out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait slides into his Porsche and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait's checking his rearview mirror. Sees a black Cadilla Escalade pull away from the curb and follow. Fait doesn't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man... He's about    to punch it. When... A cop car turns a corn and falls    in beside him. Fait throttles back. Keeps driving.     Until, finally... The cops turn off. And now Fait hits    it. Until... Traffic ahead forces Fait to turn into an alley in a semi industrial area. Behind him, the Escalade tries to follow but is cut off by the on-coming cars. We STAY WITH Fait. He GUNS down the alley. Reaches an intersecting alley. Turns. GUNS it out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally forcing its way through on-coming traffic and speeding down the alley after Fait. The ESCALADE reaches intersection. Turns. And... CRASHES into a DUMPSTER rolle into its path. The dumpster forces the Escalade into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men start to get out of the Escalade. We recognize them: Ling's two thugs. We barely have time to realize that Fait's escape has been blocked by construction equipment down the alley. He's had no choice but to turn and fight. Which is what he does, rushing the passenger. The battle's ferocious and fast. Ultimately, Fait's out- muscled and out-gunned. He's forced back against the open door of the Escalade, guns to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us the stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, how many times I gotta tell people: I'm a business man. Make me a motherfucking offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your offer. He cocks his pistol.   Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit ain't gonna do it, biggie. 'Cause I ain't scared of guns, and I ain't got the stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're gonna tell us where they are. Whereupon a...

dialogues.speaker: BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Spins through the air. The bottle knocks the gun from one Killer's hand. The gun skids under a nearby chain-link fence.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: the person who threw the bar.   Su. The fight's on.   Two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: two. Using all means available. During the battle, a kill tries to reach the gun behind the chain-link fence. Almos gets it. When... Two vicious DOBERMANS, guard dogs for the junkyard behind the fence, leap out of nowhere, SNARLING and SNAPPING and smash into the fence. The killer jumps back, barely escaping with his arm. The fight continues.   Fait and Su wear them down. Behind the fence, the Dobies want flesh. Every time someo crashes into the fence, they're right there trying to get piece. Also, every time someone crashes into the old fence, we s a series of chain-link connections loosen and break. Unti it happens one too many times. The entire fence goes down The dogs are out. The nearest targets: Su and Fait.Su and Fait must now focus their attention on fighting off and evading the ferocious attack dogs. Finally, Su kicks one dog flying. Whip-kicks the other of Fait. The two men run for the Escalade. The dogs are up i flash. Su spots an abandoned car. A rear door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here. Fait follows, right on his heels. The dogs close in. Su reaches the car. Dives through the open door. Somersaults over the rear seat. Kicks open the far door a rolls out. Fait dives in right behind him. The Dobies lea in after Fait. Fait's airborne completely through the back seat and out other side of the car. Clears the door. And... Su slams the door shut. We watch a two-Doberman pile-up against the suddenly clos door as Su leaps to the car's other side and shuts that door, too. Trapping the SNARLING, foaming DOGS inside. The bad guys are gone. And Fait's CELL PHONE is RINGING. Fait digs out the phone, to Su --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, what the hell's up with these fucking stones? (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's had the shit beat out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Archie.    Bad news.   We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO MONITOR
dialogues.text: Surveillance camera footage of Archie's. Five armed African-Americans, faces hidden under baseball caps, enter Archie's place, put Archie up against a wall start to beat something out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I did what you said, right? Put it out on the street, trying to get info on the stones. Next thing I know, the Jackson Five here show up... Now, there are three significant elements to notice here. One, I'm outnumbered. Two, they're heavily armed. Three, they're gonna beat me like a bongo drum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie, Fait and Su are watching the monitor. On screen, Archie surrenders immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I mean, hey, I coulda resisted, sure -- and they coulda beat me into a coma or killed me or whatever -- but then, see, I'm thinking: How would I be able to tell Tony what happened to the stones? Right? What good am I dead or on life-support. So I threw in the towel. Reluctantly, of course. For your sake. FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You saved yourself to tell me. So tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Uh... Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: What'd they say?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Well... 'Give us the stones, motherfucker.' You know. That kinda thing.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Pretty much.    Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: Thanks for keeping yourself alive to pass on all that valuable information.

dialogues.speaker: SU
dialogues.text: Did you call the police?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Look around. Are you crazy? Then again, maybe you are crazy, 'cause I have no idea who you are.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: Big question is, who's behind the boost?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: (re: footage) I don't know that, but I know they got great guns. I can't even get those. U.S. Special Forces only.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: ... Chambers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: He's wired into everything going down in this city, and he can get that kind of firepower. Gotta be him.

dialogues.speaker: SU
dialogues.text: Who's Chambers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs the biggest outfit in town. What warlords are to Afghanistan, Chambers is to L.A... And you want to take him on, you're on your own. Game over for me. (beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now that I'm truly fucked -- what the hell are you, anyway? You got some I.D.? Beat.   Su takes out his wallet and shows him. INSERT - I.D. In Chinese.     Clearly official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean shit to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that. Archie takes it, reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taiwan. Central Security Bureau. Taiwanese intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read Chinese? ARCHIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I know 'cop' in every language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you some kinda Asian James Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stones belong to my government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, they're Chambers' now. And even governments don't go to war with him. UNDER which, Fait's CELL PHONE starts RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to hate this phone. (answers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ling's on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you've reconsidered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Mr. Dangerous.   'Sup, 'homie'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made this difficult, Mr. Fait. Let me make it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't wait to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have your daughter. Fait freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very pretty in her pink pajamas. Aren't you, Vanessa? REVEAL Vanessa, in the limo, held by Charles.     On Ling signal, Charles uncovers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my stones, Mr. Fait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think about it a moment. Let me talk to the Chinese gentleman who's with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's up to you... The Chinese

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gentleman, please? Beat.   Fait hands the phone to Su.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to you. Su takes the phone.   In CHINESE with ENGLISH SUBTITLES -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I killed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the stones.      No negotiations. Let the girl go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want one more person to die? We see this resonates with Su.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No negotiations. And then, he simply hangs up. END INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you just do?     What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I have the stones and won't negotiate for your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will confuse him.     Buy us time and keep her alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck're you talking about? That asshole has my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I know him. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the stones, you want your daughter. We'll get them both back. We'll work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I gotta work with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no choice. Beat.   Fait realizes what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Shit... We gotta go see Chambers... (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god... Vanessa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large, empty, brightly-lit.    The door opens, and the li pulls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo stops inside the hangar.    To Charles, re:   Va

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find a place to put her. Then, as Charles forces Vanessa out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy's gonna come and kick your butts. Sona just reaches out and slaps her. It hurts and surpris Vanessa. Tears come to her eyes. But she's Fait's daughter: she won't let this bitch make her cry. Charles takes Vanessa out. Ling's mind is still on the phone call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su says he has the stones... But why cut me off? Why not negotiate for the girl? It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buyers fly in tomorrow.   Should we stop them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never regain their confidence. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need information. Find the right people. Pay whatever it costs. Something's not right. Something's happening with the stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need her... She stays alive. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In motion.     Fait and Su.   Fait on the cell to Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the way to Chambers... Yeah, I know, but I got no other choice. Just get the word into his pipeline that I'm coming and want permission to visit... I'll get back to you... Faith... (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Chambers'll have a heart and give the stones back. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right -- and maybe he'll join the Peace Corps. Su looks over.     Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your daughter... How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the Biography Channel. Let's just get there. A long beat.     L.A. moving by outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight.   She'll be nine in September. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine is fifteen... Boyfriends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never happen.    I'll just kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it were that easy. Another beat.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time I got the 4-1-1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stones aren't what you think they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the guy who has Vanessa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's exactly what you think he is -- a thief and a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered Ford camper now sits in the middle of the hang We see Vanessa inside the camper. She's screaming. Loudly Not scared. Pissed. As... Ling Thug #2 covers the windows with black spray paint.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS HANGAR
dialogues.text: Ling Thug #2 hands car keys to Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say Grandma and Grandpa have a long walk back from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: campground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you cleaned it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything except the denture cream and adult diapers. Vanessa's still screaming.   It's getting on Charles' ner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of her already. He marches toward the van.   Unlocks the rear door and sl it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa is standing inside, still yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep! Vanessa reaches over and flicks ON the camper's TV.   Tur it UP LOUD. Giving him stink-eye defiance as... Charles slams the door shut.   Locks it.   And... Now that Vanessa's made her point, and Charles can't see anymore, her boldness begins to subside. She lies down on the bed and curls up, alone and scared inside the dark camper. Vanessa holds up the pink diamond pendant and gazes at it A talisman. Connecting her to her father. Not making the fear go away, but giving her strength.

dialogues.speaker: FAIT
dialogues.text: As he drives, just as if he can sense Vanessa's need for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels east, angels west, north and south, do your best. Guard her, watch her, while she rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF which, as Su regards him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prison guard escorts Fait and Su past cells, each just dreary, spare and institutional as the next. That is, unt they reach the last cell. The last cell is guarded by two convict sentries.    Hang blankets cloak the cell entirely from view. Fait, Su and the prison guard stop outside the cell. One sentry blocks the way in as the other parts the blankets covering the open cell doorway, REVEALING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a walk through Kansas, this is the land of Oz. The last cell is as comfy, colorful and a well-appointed as Joel's office. JUMP CHAMBERS, a large, brutal-looking, inner-city crime lord has clearly used money and influence to improve the terms of his incarceration. Chambers puffs a Cuban as a prison trustee, WILLY CHICKEN sets out breakfast before him: fresh-squeezed OJ; eggs benedict; large, juicy sausages; fresh breads and pastrie French-press coffee; LA TIMES, NY TIMES, WSJ, Maxim, Hust and the daily mail. The guard leaves Fait and Su, turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metz. The guard, METZ, stops and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.V.D.'s broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get you a new one straight away, Mr. Chambers. Metz goes. Beat.   Chambers eyes Fait and Su through his cigar smoke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your patience.   Man needs his nightly rest. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the gook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Chinese guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No shoes in my crib. Then, when Fait and Su have removed their shoes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In. The sentries move aside. Fait and Su enter. Chambers ash- trays his Cuban and digs into b-fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Jump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waste my precious time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Daria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always was good. From the moment I found her till the moment you took her away from me. Problem, you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The black stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch brought it in. Made me a lotta money. But that all stopped. You stopped that. You decided it was okay to put an end to that. Black stones. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need 'em back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only smart thing was not pimping her yourself, 'cause then I'da been real sore-angry, and you'da both been real cold-dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't pimp, do you? Just a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thief in the night. Stealing what don't belong to you. Chambers turns to Su.   In SUBTITLED KOREAN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like tall white women? Su doesn't say anything.   Back to English --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't speak Korean. Chambers carves up a sausage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought myself this Korean club downtown. Packing in the Seoul brothers 24-7-365... Black man gouging Koreans, ain't that a switch... Motherfuckers got faces like walls, but they love to drink liquor and look at naked girls... Place is no shitbox, either. Got me an office looks like a kabuki love palace. My own little sanctuary -- A QUICK SHOT OF Fait, taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just waiting for when I parole out... Stop by sometime, eyeball the poon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jump, my daughter's mixed up in this. I gotta have the stones, or she's dead. No response.   Chambers just keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need something more than that, here it is... (this is hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm begging you, Jump. Still no response... Chambers finishes eating.    Wipes h face. Finally -- CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big heist. Risky heist. Breaking news. I'm watching it wondering why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's worth that kind of trouble, that kind of heat? Gotta be something good. Gotta be something expensive. Beat.   He meets Fait's eyes.   Holds them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make another one... Lotta offspring running around. Big scores're rare in a lifetime. Another beat.   That's it.   No deal. Fait takes a sudden step toward Chambers.     Su stops hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slope's no dope. He indicates behind them. They turn. The two cell sentrie are wielding prison shanks. So is Willy Chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me cut one of these motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice. Chickens is happy.   Thrusts the knife at Fait.       Whe Su reaches out and catches the   blade.  Catches it with the thumb and forefinger of one   hand.  And holds it lik that. Holds it hard. Chickens     can't push and can't pu Doesn't know what to do next.    Finally yanks really har And... Su lets go. Chickens goes backward, ass over teakettle. A beat. Then, to Fait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hey to Daria. And don't forget your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Su walk toward the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to look up to that guy.      All I wanted was to be like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Taiwan, I could force him to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't Taiwan. (then) Only thing we can do now is find out where the stones are and go take 'em. SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it sound easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be. They're about to get in the car. Fait stops.     Looks ba the prison. Suddenly realizing something. FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... They're at his club. SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I can feel it.      That ever happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Chinese people were all mystical and shit. SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like to gamble.     Not guess. FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no guess... But I could be wrong... We'll hit the club. You gotta see Archie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie? FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta remember something about the guys who took down his place. SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he can't? FAIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend it's Taiwan.    Make him remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSSELL, the science and technology end of Ling's operati carries a piece of equipment from the back of a five-ton truck and approaches some kind of strange contraption, wh he's in the process of erecting in the middle of the hang He puts down what he's carrying next to the contraption a starts back for something else, when he sees Charles is looking in the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Get away from there! Russell hurries over, extremely edgy, almost manic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Take it easy. Just seeing if I could help with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't! It's very delicate equipment! Stay away! Just stay away from my truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from my truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from my truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Sona's emerging from a trailer/office nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Charles does. And now we can hear Vanessa, who's begun screaming inside the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daddy! Charles backs up, continuing to address Russell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm backing away... I'm backing away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daddy! I want my daddy! Charles joins Sona.   Re:   Russell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone give the geek his Ritalin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he's doing his job. Which is more than I can say for some people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daddy! I want my daddy! Sona tosses Charles a roll of duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tape her up and gag her. As Vanessa continues to SCREAM, Charles moves to the van, unlocks the rear door with the key/remote and pockets it. Then opens the door. And... Vanessa bolts out, crying, and clamps her arms around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daddy! I want my daddy!    I want my daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell off me. He pries loose her arms from around him. Keeping a grip o her wrists with one hand, Charles turns her around to fac away from him. He's about to start duct-taping her wrists

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Waste of time... I can think of a better way of shutting you up -- Vanessa back-kicks him hard in the 'nads.   Charles howls pain and lets her go. Quickly, Vanessa jumps back inside the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa slams the sliding rear door shut. And now... We suddenly realize she has the key and remote! The crying just an act she put on to pickpocket Charles. Vanessa pus the remote. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK go the DOOR LOCKS. Charles, still in pain, is surprised to hear this. Feels his pocket. Realizes the ke and remote are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (yells to Sona)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got the key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa climbs into the driver's seat. Puts the key into the ignition and STARTS the ENGINE. Puts it in "D."

dialogues.speaker: ACCELERATOR PEDAL
dialogues.text: To reveal Vanessa's rigged a soda can to the pedal. An extension for her short legs. As her foot tromps down on can...

dialogues.speaker: CAMPER
dialogues.text: takes off. The windows are blacked out and Vanessa can't see where she's going. But she's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camper careens around the large space.   Charles scrambles after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa keeps driving blind, pedal to the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMPER veers toward the rear wall.   And... ... CRASHES into a support post. As Charles yanks Vanessa from the wrecked van, unhurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostess bar, but very high-end. Beautiful women. Elegan decor. Pumping MUSIC. No strip-club cheese. For extra money, private rooms for private pleasures. It's day, but the place is wall-to-wall with Korean men. Chambers' African-Americans maintain low visibility:   at door, behind the scenes, counting the register, etc. ODION, a dangerous-looking Chambers main man, moves throu the crowd to Daria, waiting near the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delicious Daria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sup, Odion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time no see. Then, checking her out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like cognac. Just getting better. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings you around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sometimes you need an old friend, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... With a capital 'T.' ODION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Fait? Thought you and him were tight. Bonnie and Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be that way. Not treating me right these days. The kid's all he cares about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Man, I don't know. Probably nothing you can do. I just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thought... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, y'know, this is crazy. I don't know what I was thinking. I shouldn't even be here like this. Sorry, Odion. Daria starts to go.   Odion stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, hey, hold up. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the day... Just always seemed like you and I had something special between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know you thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always cared for you, Odion. That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You looking for a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So maybe you could work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?... Oh, man, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the best. Not many girls pulling in two g's a night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's been a while for that... Might not remember how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like a bicycle, baby.     You don't forget that stuff. Daria considers it a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know how Jump'd feel about it. Having me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you let me worry about Jump,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime, why don't you come on in, and you and me can, y'know, talk some more about it. Beat.   Daria knows the look in his eyes.   Gets the subt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Just talk? Odion's drinking her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No. A beat. Then, as Daria reaches out and slips her hand int Odion's, smiling at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su and Archie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have boxing matches in the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly boxing. More dangerous. No gloves. No rules. Big money. Very illegal... Started holding 'em during the daytime to fool the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man you remembered -- how do you know he will be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. But Chambers owns the operation, so I figure it's a good place to start. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. They turn into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous industrial building.   Cars parked on the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they park --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you recognize him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see his face.   But I'll know his pinkie ring when I  see it. Ten carats. Round cut with   square mount. Good color and clarity.   I remember thinking what it would  do to my face if he hit me. OFF Su's dubious look, as Archie crams on a baseball hat help disguise himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Su exit the car and approach a GUARD manning a gate to the fight arena beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave that to me. Then, to the Guard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, how you doing? Got a fighter here I want to enter. Su shoots him a surprised look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man's gonna put the rest of these bums to beddy-bye. He'll go in there and get all Chinese on 'em -- the teeth are gonna fly, the blood's gonna run... Gonna be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever... You're number twelve, Bruce. He hands a card reading "12" to Su. As Archie and Su make their way toward the arena --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't have to. That was just to get us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the arena. It's also huge. Packed with men. Hazy with smoke. Loud with betting, cheers and boos. A large, chain-link cage stands at the center of the room Inside, two battered and bloodied fighters are beating th shit out of each other. Like at    a Gallagher concert, front row fans have sheet plastic    over their laps. Whenever a hard kick or punch lands,    the nearest fans quickly raise the plastic shee shield    themselves from flying blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, over a million dollars'll pass hands in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Okay. He looks around.      Lotta African-American males.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could take a little while. As Archie starts moving through the crowd, looking at han and Su follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria and Odion enter, and Odion closes the door. He star to take her in his arms. Daria slows him up. Guides him back toward a sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Odion sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on some music. Odion puts a DISC in the STEREO.        Cranks up some HI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.    Something slower. Odion SWITCHES MUSIC.        A SLOW TUNE fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... Now just relax... And watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria just stands there a moment, getting her body into t music. Then starts dancing for him. Slow and sexy. And Odion's eating it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Miles climb onto the roof with gear bags.   Via earwig mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's behind the wheel, wearing a pest control uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here come da bug man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORMAN watches Tommy drive up in the pest-control truck, put on a respirator, get out, unreel 20 feet of pe spray hose from the truck and advance toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.    Howzit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pest control. Don't tell me you didn't get your notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What notice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that burns my ass right to the bone. I mean, hey, I'm here doing my job... Anyway, putting that aside, if you had gotten your notice, you'd know there's a new city ordinance saying all businesses catering to foreigners gotta be sprayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?    How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause foreign people're bringing all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: their scary-assed foreign bugs over here. Y'know, in their luggage and shit. And then the bugs're getting loose and fucking everything up -- eating all the trees and everything, y'know, making people sick... Anyway, city says we gotta spray to prevent any infestation and possible spread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing business inside. Can't let you just start hosing the place with bug spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, maybe you should at least ask the manager about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manager's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay. Your call. Just know the city quarantine people'll be here first thing tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarantine people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be shutting you down for non- compliance... Peace out. Tommy starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait. Tommy stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City's really gonna come and close us up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quicker'n a Zip-loc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You sure you're not fucking with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a licensed exterminator.   Why would I be fucking with you? The Doorman considers it another moment.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Let's do this. You let me start with a couple small rooms, y'know, offices or something, someplace you don't have customers. Upstairs, so the fumes don't bother anybody. I'll pop off a couple bug bombs, and then we'll do the rest later. How's that? The Doorman considers a moment.     Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah, okay. Get the bombs, and come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria keeps dancing. Peeling off layers now.    Showing s Odion's starting to salivate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Chambers' cell is to a normal cell, this place is to normal office. No expense spared. (Think Joel again.) A large, "Zen" FOUNTAIN BURBLES meditatively in the center the room. The door opens.   The Doorman admits Tommy, who looks aro in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Look.   At.   This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do your thing and go, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. He positions the BUG BOMBS. Then.... PFFFT.     He sets o one. PFFFT. The other. As he goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep the door closed and be sure to give this shit a full hour before anyone comes in. OFF the closing door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait and Miles grab gear bags and mobilize. Clip onto ascender/descenders and lower themselves to a second-stor window. A window into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the BUG BOMBS HISS away. Fait tries the WINDOW. Locked shut. He quickly tapes it. BREAKS it. He and Miles climbs inside. Grab the bug bombs and toss them out. As Miles locks the door, Fait opens a gear bag and pulls a folding metal detector. Uses it to scan the entire room quickly: floor, walls, ceiling... Gets LOW-VOLUME RING-OF from various hidden metal. But he's looking for something bigger. BLEEE.   He gets it when he sweeps past Chambers' big des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe. He kneels.     Removes a desk panel.   And... There it is.     The safe is small but highly secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it down. Miles finishes assembling a Barrett .50 caliber rifle. A big gun. Opens an ammo box labeled "Depleted Uranium. .50 cal."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria's down to bare essentials -- still dancing slow and sexy for Odion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles loads one of the massive D.U. cartridges into the Barrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with the music, they're gonna hear it when I fire this tank buster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daria.   Get ready to move. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Miles aims the BARRETT directly at the safe lock.      Mi FIRES. BIG BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odion starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically, the lock's just gone. Melted. Burned through b the DU slug. Fait swings the safe door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odion's heading out the door. When he stops.       Looks Daria. A realization dawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sometimes you need an old friend'... He steps toward Daria.    Backhands her.   Hard.   Then o the door. A CHAMBERS MAN outside the door addresses Odion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came from the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch her.   Don't let her leave. Odion goes. The Man enters. Shuts the door, leering at Daria, who starts putting on what she's taken off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fait's tossed the safe.     No stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.    Somewhere else.
